rComments: Despite my dislike of linear algebra, I enjoyed my time with Daniele. The class grade is completely based off of assessments, which is intimidating. Luckily he is helpful outside of class; if you put in the effort to go talk to him, he'll make sure you understand. He's caring and entertaining, and obviously very passionate about math. Five stars!

Even though he is a nice professor its a very tough class due to the incoherence of his lectures which are solely based on theorems and proofs making it hard to understand the topics.  The class is made up of 5 quizzes which is 70% of your grade and a final.  Says that the quizzes are just like the homework but that is not always true.

I really enjoy having Venturi as a professor for AMS 10. Really easy going and wants whats best for the students. Really funny and is pretty cute. Assigns  hw  but it isn't graded. Its more for practice for the Quizzes which are 70% of the grade overall. Also he plays guitar. Can't get any better than that. Italian accent. I'd take his class again

Currently have him as a professor for AMS 10 and I really like his way teaching. Hes a really funny nice guy who genuinely cares about his students and whether they understand the subject. If you ask a question in class he always stops to explain. Definitely recommend taking him. Also he's pretty hot lol. Nice smile with a cute dimple. Good prof

The professor was tough but very caring about the quality of his course, teaching and state of his students. He made it clear that his expectations were high, but he also delivered in his lectures and his interactions with students. Great class and a great professor.

70% of class is weighted for quizzes, but when asked in office hours Venturi says, "I dont care about the grade on tests" Lectures mostly on theory, so dont bet on understanding anything from lecture. teach yourself everything

The course was challenging yet fair. It's not an easy A course. You are expected to work and take several tests - they are quite tough. But I'm glad I took it, I learned a lot. The professor is amazing, his lectures were really interesting. Also he was very accessible outside the classroom and super helpful. One of the best professors I've had.

Lectures are interesting and explanations clear. The lectures notes are provided to students which is really useful. Professor Venturi brings concrete examples and makes linear algebra exciting. He is always available for office hours and helpful. Plus, he is hot ;). Overall one of the best math classes I have taken.

Amazing Teacher on the Level expected at the University. He is not a Math teacher, he teaches applied math because he hold degrees in advanced subjects that apply. If I had only half the analytical knowledge he did, I would be beside myself! He always responds, is patient with explanations, and will not quit on you. A wonderful experience so far.
Great at lectures. Draws pretty pictures. His research is interesting.

He has a moderate Italian accent, so beware if you can't understand accents. Grade was based entirely on quizzes which were very difficult, with many obscure questions. He's okay if you use the textbook/supplementary materials over his lectures. Also, he doesn't answer questions well in class, often not understanding what the student is asking.
